00008 struct process_entry_t
00009 {
00010         process_t* process_pointer;
00011         int ticks_tell_die;
00012 
00013         struct process_entry_t* next;
00014 };
00015 
00016 typedef struct process_entry_t scheduler_proc;
00017 
00018 scheduler_proc* list_root = 0;
00019 scheduler_proc* list_current = 0;
00020 
00021 process_t* get_current_process();
00022 
00023 void initializeScheduler(process_t* kp)
00024 {
00025         //Create and set new_process to all 0's
00026         scheduler_proc* new_process = malloc(sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00027         memset(new_process, 0, sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00028 
00029         //Set its process pointer to the kernels processing path
00030         new_process->process_pointer = kp;
00031         
00032         //Loop backs
00033         new_process->next = new_process;
00034 
00035         //Set the root and current set of the list to new_process
00036         list_root = new_process;
00037         list_current = new_process;
00038 }
00039 
00040 void swapToProcess(scheduler_proc* scheduler_entry)
00041 {
00042         process_t* old_proc = list_current->process_pointer;
00043         
00044         setKernelStack(KERNEL_STACK_START);
00045 
00046         //Swap to the next process
00047         list_current = scheduler_entry;
00048 
00049         process_t* new_proc = list_current->process_pointer;
00050 
00051         //Give me a nano!
00052         list_current->ticks_tell_die = _STD_NANO_;
00053 
00054         //Swap to the new process
00055         switch_process(old_proc, new_proc);
00056 }
00057 
00058 void scheduler_on_tick()
00059 {
00060         if (list_root == 0) return;
00061 
00062         if (list_current->ticks_tell_die < 1)
00063         {
00064                 if (list_current->next->process_pointer->m_shouldDestroy == 1)
00065                 {
00066                         swapToProcess(list_root);
00067                 }
00068                 else
00069                 {
00070                         swapToProcess(list_current->next);
00071                 }
00072 
00073         } else
00074         {
00075 
00076                 //increment the counter of the time spent on this process
00077                 list_current->process_pointer->m_processingTime++;
00078 
00079                 //One tick closer to being context switched
00080                 list_current->ticks_tell_die--;
00081         }
00082 }
00083 
00084 
00085 //To anybody calling this function, remember to re-enable interrupts where applicable
00086 void scheduler_add(process_t* op)
00087 {
00088         //Create and set new_process to all 0's
00089         scheduler_proc* new_process = malloc(sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00090         memset(new_process, 0, sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00091 
00092         new_process->process_pointer = op;
00093 
00094         unsigned int iterator = 0;
00095 
00096         scheduler_proc* iterator_process = list_root;
00097 
00098         //Loop to find the last entry in the list
00099         for(;;)
00100         {
00101                 if (iterator_process->next == list_root)
00102                 {
00103                         break;
00104                 }
00105                 else
00106                 {
00107                         iterator_process = iterator_process->next;
00108                 }
00109         }
00110 
00111         iterator_process->next = new_process;
00112 
00113         new_process->next = list_root;
00114 }
00115 
00116 //To anybody calling this, remember to re-enable interrupts
00117 void scheduler_remove(process_t* op)
00118 {
00119 
00120         //Find the scheduler entry
00121         scheduler_proc* iterator_process = list_root;
00122 
00123         for (;;)
00124         {
00125                 if (iterator_process->next == list_root)
00126                 {
00127                         return; //Cannot find the right proc
00128                 }
00129                 else
00130                 {
00131                         //Is the next process the one that needs to be removed
00132                         if (iterator_process->next->process_pointer == op)
00133                         {
00134                                 //Process
00135                                 break;
00136                         }
00137                         else
00138                         {
00139                                 iterator_process = iterator_process->next;
00140                         }
00141                 }
00142         }
00143 
00144 
00145         //Store the proc
00146         scheduler_proc* next = iterator_process->next;
00147 
00148         if (list_current == next)
00149         {
00150                 PANIC("Scheduler trying to remove currently accessed process, this shouldn't happen... DEBUG!!\n");
00151         }
00152 
00153         //Remove it from the list
00154         iterator_process->next = iterator_process->next->next;
00155 
00156         //Free it
00157         free(next);
00158 
00159         DEBUG_PRINT("Removed scheduler entry\n");
00160 
00161         return;
00162 }
00163 
00164 //Sleeps the current process on the next tick
00165 void scheduler_block_me()
00166 {
00167         if (list_current == 0) return;
00168 
00169         list_current->ticks_tell_die = 0;
00170 }
00171 
00172 process_t* get_current_process()
00173 {
00174         if (list_current == 0) return 0;
00175 
00176         return list_current->process_pointer;
00177 }
00178 
00179 int scheduler_num_processes()
00180 {
00181         if (list_root == 0) return 0;
00182         
00183         scheduler_proc* iter = list_root;
00184 
00185         int numTotal = 0;
00186 
00187         while (1)
00188         {
00189                 numTotal++;
00190 
00191                 if (iter->next == list_root)
00192                 {
00193                         break;
00194                 }
00195                 
00196                 iter = iter->next;
00197         }
00198 
00199         return numTotal;
00200 }
00201 
00202 void scheduler_kill_current_process()
00203 {
00204         if (list_current == 0) return 0;
00205 
00206         process_t* process = get_current_process();
00207         process->m_shouldDestroy = 1;
00208 
00209         for (;;)
00210         {
00211                 scheduler_on_tick(); //Fake ticks untill the next process is brought into context. Next time this process is handled by the scheduler it will be destroyed
00212         }
00213 }
00214 
00215 process_t* scheduler_return_process(unsigned int iter)
00216 {
00217         scheduler_proc* iterator = list_root;
00218         unsigned int i = 0;
00219 
00220         for (i = 0; i < iter; i++)
00221         {
00222                 if (iterator->next == list_root) return 0;
00223                 iterator = iterator->next;
00224         }
00225 
00226         return iterator->process_pointer;
00227 }
00228 
00229 process_t* schedulerGetProcessFromPid(unsigned int pid)
00230 {
00231 
00232         scheduler_proc* iterator = list_root;
00233         unsigned int i = 0;
00234 
00235         for (;;)
00236         {
00237                 //If it is the process I'm loooking for break
00238                 if (iterator->process_pointer->m_ID == pid) break;
00239 
00240                 //If its the last entry and not correct then return null
00241                 if (iterator->next == list_root) return 0;
00242 
00243                 //Set the iterator to the next entry
00244                 iterator = iterator->next;
00245         }
00246 
00247         //Return what I got
00248         return iterator->process_pointer;
00249 }

00251 void scheduler_global_message(process_message msg, unsigned int bit)
00252 {
00253         scheduler_proc* iter = list_root;
00254 
00255         while (1)
00256         {
00257                 //Test if this process wants to hear about this event
00258                 if (iter->process_pointer->m_postboxFlags & bit == bit)
00259                 {
00260                         postbox_add(&iter->process_pointer->m_processPostbox, msg);
00261 
00262                 }
00263 
00264                 if (iter->next == list_root) break;
00265 
00266                 iter = iter->next;
00267 
00268         }
00269 
00270 }
